structuralFindings.rationale: Honda operates a classic Hybrid/Hub-and-Spoke model with multiple distinct AI/research centers (Honda Research Institute USA, HRI Japan, HRI Europe, Honda R&D Innovation Lab Tokyo) that maintain regional specialization while sharing a global project management matrix. The Honda Research Institutes focus on fundamental AI research (autonomous driving, machine learning, robotics, quantum computing) while American Honda's IT organization under Bob Brizendine handles enterprise AI adoption (Copilot, generative AI for productivity). Additionally, the Sony Honda Mobility joint venture (AFEELA) represents a separate AI-focused venture structure. This multi-tiered approach — research institutes for exploration, IT for enterprise adoption, and JV for product-focused AI — is distinctly Structural in orientation with clear separation of units.
structuralFindings.aiTeamStructure: Multi-layered structure: (1) Honda Research Institutes (HRI) — global network with locations in USA (Silicon Valley, new Ohio lab opening Q4 2025), Japan, and Europe, focused on fundamental research in AI, robotics, autonomous vehicles, quantum computing; (2) Honda R&D Innovation Lab Tokyo (Akasaka Biz Tower) — product development for AI applications, part of R&D Center X focused on robotics, mobility services, AI, and energy; (3) American Honda IT — enterprise AI adoption led by SVP IT Bob Brizendine with CDO Arun Yarlagadda, handling generative AI governance and deployment; (4) Sony Honda Mobility (AFEELA JV) — dedicated to AI-powered mobility and software-defined vehicles; (5) Honda CI (Cooperative Intelligence) research — original Honda AI for human-machine understanding, with IIT Delhi/Bombay partnership.

structuralFindings.investmentSignals: No specific AI budget or headcount disclosed. Key investment signals: (1) New HRI lab opening at Ohio State University SciTech Campus Q4 2025 focused on quantum, nanotech, hydrogen, EV batteries; (2) Multi-year workforce training program on AI spanning executives through developers; (3) Partnership with Microsoft for Copilot/ChatGPT Enterprise across O365 users; (4) Sony Honda Mobility JV targeting AFEELA 1 deliveries in California late 2026, funded by both Sony and Honda. FY2026 guidance shows overall company operating profit target of ¥700 billion but AI-specific allocation not broken out.

observableMarkers.reportingStructure: AI research (HRI) reports through R&D organization. Enterprise AI at American Honda reports through IT (Bob Brizendine as SVP). No dedicated CAIO role identified — CDO (Yarlagadda) elevated to same level as CISO/CPO. Sony Honda Mobility is separate JV.
observableMarkers.resourceAllocation: Research labs appear to have ring-fenced R&D budgets. Enterprise AI uses vendor partnerships (Microsoft, ServiceNow, Salesforce, GitHub). HRI expansion to Ohio suggests continued R&D investment. AFEELA has dedicated JV capital structure.
observableMarkers.timeHorizons: Mixed: HRI focuses on long-term research (quantum, autonomous driving, robotics). Enterprise AI has near-term productivity focus. Honda CI proof-of-concept underway in Joso City. AFEELA targeting 2026-2028 production vehicles.
observableMarkers.decisionRights: Distributed across units. American Honda IT has autonomy over enterprise AI governance. HRI has research autonomy. Sony Honda Mobility has JV governance structure.
observableMarkers.metrics: Enterprise AI: workforce training completion, governance compliance, tool adoption. Research: not disclosed but likely publication/patent-focused. AFEELA: vehicle deliveries and customer adoption metrics.

summary: Honda operates a Hybrid/Hub-and-Spoke model with multiple distinct AI structures: (1) Honda Research Institutes (HRI) — a global network of fundamental AI research labs in USA, Japan, and Europe focusing on autonomous driving, robotics, machine learning, and quantum computing; (2) American Honda's IT organization handling enterprise generative AI adoption with a 5-part strategy emphasizing governance, domain-specific applications, and human-in-the-loop design; (3) The Sony Honda Mobility joint venture developing AI-powered AFEELA vehicles with integrated conversational AI agents. This structural separation allows exploration in research labs while enterprise IT focuses on near-term productivity gains and the JV pursues AI-native product development.

conferenceFindings: At CES 2026, Sony Honda Mobility (the Honda-Sony JV) world-premiered the AFEELA Prototype 2026 and announced AFEELA 1 deliveries in California for late 2026. The AFEELA Personal Agent leverages Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service for conversational AI. SHM positions vehicles as 'Creative Entertainment Spaces' powered by vehicle AI that understands user preferences and emotions. Partnership with Qualcomm for Snapdragon Digital Chassis automotive computing platform. This represents Honda's AI-native product venture for next-generation mobility, separate from core Honda R&D. Note: The domain-specific automotive LLM mentioned in target context was not explicitly found — AFEELA uses Microsoft Azure OpenAI rather than a Honda-developed LLM.
